content.question: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 was a law passed by Congress prohibiting discrimination based on sex. Which of the following describes how the policy is being implemented?

choices.label: The bureaucracy will create rules for enforcement and will have the discretion to implement those rules.
Congress will issue an order for states to comply with the law.
The Supreme Court will issue a ruling on the constitutionality of the law if a case naturally arises.
The president will veto sections of the bill but will enforce other sections.

content.answer: The bureaucracy will create rules for enforcement and will have the discretion to implement those rules.
